00:46 - EFF's thoughts on EARN IT act
01:13 - Why is this so bad?
02:30 - Why client side scanning is horrible
03:17 - End to end encryption can be considered as evidence of recklessness/negligence
04:17 - Reading the bill
07:07 - The "feel good" member of the commission" 
07:15 - Unelected people who will create "best practices"
08:20 - HERE'S THE PROBLEM!
08:30 - RIP end to end encryption without client side scanning
09:19 - 99.9% shouldn't lose security & privacy because 0.1% are bad

10:06 - False flags
11:01 - What everyone should tell their senator
11:10 - A reminder of what got someone reported
11:20 - The human reviewer approved of this

13:33 - End to end encryption is allowed, but can be held against you.
